Circular.text: Reflexive verbs often describe an action where the doer does something to themselves, for example, the shoresh לבש corresponds to the concept of clothing, and the causative verb from that shoresh is לְהִתְלַבֵּשׁ, which means "to dress oneself."

Transformative actions.text: Reflexive verbs can also refer to situations where an entity undergoes a transformation, for example, the shoresh חדש means "newness," and the reflexive verb לְהִתְחַדֵּשׁ means "to revitalize" ie for something to transform into being new.
